description: oval shaped body with four "legs" running lengthwise; two halves open with swinging wire
text: Whether the potato baker is a great invention or simply a good intention is questionable. But, as streamline form, it is undeniably "so yesterday." By releasing the spring-snap lock and separating the baking shell, a potato could be inserted onto a central spit or rod. The baker was then placed over a gas flame or electric burner for approximately an hour. It eliminated "heating up a stove for one lone potato." The effect is "a new taste thrill, a delicious new potato flavor and texture, soft and flaky, resulting from baking the potato in its own moisture."
title: "Top-O-Stove" potato baker
